array: Quartz (SiO2) is a widely abundant mineral with a multitude of applications.
Midwest Neostone is building a Quartz processing facility in Andhra Pradesh, with Commenced Phase I facility targeting 303,600 metric tonnes capacity.*
Phase II will increase capacity to 606,600 metric tonnes, refining rejects for high-purity Quartz used in engineered stone and solar glass.*

With the operationalization of Phase I, Midwest will be one of the few players worldwide to incorporate a mine-to-market integrated business model for the production of Quartz grit and powder, i.e., offering capabilities across mining, processing, packing, distribution, and branding of Quartz.*

tabs.title: Market
list: Quartz is widely used in industries such as solar glass, engineered stone, and semiconductors.
Domestic production of quartz in India reached 4,989 KT in fiscal 2024, growing at a 17.8% CAGR from fiscal 2022.
Rajasthan is the largest producer, accounting for 49% of India's total quartz output in fiscal 2024, followed by Telangana (23%) and Andhra Pradesh (21%).
Quartz exports to markets such as China, Malaysia, Vietnam, and Korea grew by 47% in fiscal 2024, with China accounting for 45% of India's total export volume.
India remains a net exporter, consistently exporting larger volumes of quartz than it imports, with export values increasing by 164% in fiscal 2024.

tabs.title: Growth
list: The quartz market is projected to grow at a CAGR of 8-8.5% through fiscal 2029, with production expected to reach 7,331-7,502 KT.
Domestic demand for quartz is projected to reach 6,166-6,516 KT by fiscal 2029, driven by the growth of the solar glass, electronics, and engineered stone industries.
The demand for quartz in solar panel manufacturing is expected to rise sharply, with quartz grit accounting for 65-70% of the raw materials in solar panel glass.
India is among the leading exporters, alongside China and Turkey, with a 21.5% YoY growth in Quartz slab exports.*
India currently imports 65% of its solar glass needs, but domestic supply is expected to rise to 70-80% by FY 2029.*
Quartz demand for solar glass is expected to grow at a CAGR of 30.7-31.4%, reaching 2,100-2,160 KT by FY 2029.*
Midwest plans to add 0.5 mnT of quartz grit capacity for solar glass, meeting 15-18% of FY 2029 demand.*

details.description: Fine powder, typically ranging from 0.1mm to 1.2mm. Ideal for construction and decorative surfaces like countertops and flooring.
applications: Abrasive blasting: Used to clean and polish surfaces through abrasive blasting, which involves blowing compressed air or water through a nozzle to remove impurities and smooth out surfaces.
Abrasive cutting: Used in abrasive cutting tools, such as saw blades and grinding wheels, to cut through hard materials, such as metal, stone and manufacture engineered stone.
Water filtration: Used in water filtration systems to remove impurities and contaminants from water.
Used in manufacturing of Engineered Slab Industry, Solar and Glass Industries.
Solar glass manufacturing: For production of solar glass used in solar panels.

applications: Quartz powder of size 400 mesh is used in the Engineering slab industry.
